qas.question: Of what Congressional district is Seattle a part?
Who is the representative for Seattle's district?
When was McDermott elected to office?
Who is the present mayor of Seattle?
To which states' election laws are Seattle's law and ballots similar?

context: <a4_0>Like most<a4_0/> parts of the United States, government and laws are also run by a series of ballot initiatives (allowing citizens to pass or reject laws), referenda (allowing citizens to approve or reject legislation already passed), and propositions (allowing specific government agencies to propose new laws/tax increases directly to the people). Federally, Seattle is part of Washington's <a0_0>7th congressional district<a0_0/>, represented by Democrat <a1_0>Jim McDermott<a1_0/>, elected in <a2_0>1988<a2_0/> and one of Congress's liberal members. <a3_0>Ed Murray<a3_0/> is currently serving as mayor.
